articles.description: A minimum of three players would need to fail the NRL's pre-match COVID-19 temperature screening tests before officials make a decision on whether to cancel a game, says a top official of the sport.
articles.content: A minimum of three players would need to fail the NRL's pre-match COVID-19 temperature screening tests before officials make a decision on whether to cancel a game, says a top official of the sport.… [+1982 chars]

articles.title: Socceroos keeper Mitch Langerak tests positive for coronavirus ahead of J-League restart - ABC News
articles.description: Socceroos keeper Mitch Langerak tests positive for coronavirus, the second player in his Japanese club to do so ahead of the J-League season restart.
articles.content:
Socceroos goalkeeper Mitch Langerak is facing a stint on the sidelines after testing positive for coronavirus at J-League club Nagoya Grampus.

articles.title: Australia is 'finally' acting on talk of 'self-reliance, security, and sovereignty' - Sky News Australia
articles.description:
Liberal Senator Jim Molan says Australia has “finally stopped just talking about self-reliance, security, and sovereignty” and instead has started to act amid major changes to foreign investment laws.
